title: A 480-million-year-old fossil changes what we know about the origin of parasites
description: Ancient fossils unearthed in Morocco reveal parasitic worms burrowing into mollusc shells approximately 480 million years ago, pushing back the known timeline for parasitism by 60 million years. This discovery in the Fezouata Shale formation offers a remarkable glimpse into complex early marine ecosystems, showcasing sophisticated host-parasite interactions much earlier than previously believed.

Technical glitch at Delhi airport: Hundreds of flights delayed; what caused disruption
description: Hundreds of flights faced delays at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport due to a technical glitch in the Air Traffic Control system. The Automatic Message Switching System crashed, forcing controllers to manually process every flight. This slowdown significantly impacted operations at India's busiest airport. Airlines warned passengers of extended waiting times. Technical teams are working to restore the system, but a timeline for normal operations remains unclear. The disruption highlights the critical reliance on automated systems in aviation.

What really happens inside your body when you hold your breath too long
description: Scientists explored how repeated breath-holding impacts the body.  A study found that practicing breath-holding techniques significantly increases endurance.  This improvement stems from the body becoming more efficient at balancing oxygen and carbon dioxide.  The repetition itself, rather than specific techniques, conditions the body.  This physiological adaptation allows for longer holds and quicker recovery.

description: The stretch between Chevella and Manneguda on NH-163 has long been flagged by locals, commuters and road safety analysts as a death corridor: narrow lanes, poor lighting, unscientific curves and movement of heavy vehicles. One moment of reckless driving is all it takes for an ordinary commute to turn catastrophic. The November 3 crash between a State-run bus and a tipper lorry that claimed 19 lives is not an isolated tragedy but part of a chilling pattern. Lavpreet Kaur and Naveen Kumar find that alleged infrastructure negligence and careless driving are not separate issues but two sides of the same threat

The accused, Rene Joshilda, allegedly used her ex-lover's name to implicate him in the crime. She was taken into Bengaluru police custody on a body warrant.

title: A small plaque in Mylapore that keeps alive Rabindranath  Tagore’s first visit to Madras
description: While visiting Madras in 1919, the Nobel laureate stayed at the residence of Justice T. Muthuswamy Iyer, the first Indian to serve as a judge of the Madras High Court during the British period. In 2005, the descendants of Iyer sold the house to S. H. Mohideen  and his family, which chose to retain its historic name as a matter of pride

title: Pavalar Varadharajan, an artist who played key role in Communist Party’s victory in Kerala
description: The Devikulam by-election in 1958 was crucial for the Namboodiripad government. To tap into plantation workers who were mostly Tamils, the Communist Party organised concerts by Pavalar Varadharajan, whose songs went down very well with electors

description: Ravi Shastri recounted a fiery 1991-92 tour of Australia, advising an 18-year-old Sachin Tendulkar to let his bat do the talking amidst Australian sledging.  Shastri himself had a verbal spat with Mike Whitney, but urged Tendulkar, who was eager to retaliate, to rely on his immense talent. This advice shaped Tendulkar's legendary career against Australia.

title: Marshawn Kneeland girlfriend: Who is Catalina, the woman who loved the late Cowboys star?

Peter Thiel’s warning resurfaces: What he predicted about Zohran Mamdani?
description: Tech titan Peter Thiel warned Silicon Valley in 2020 that rising millennial support for socialism stemmed from economic hardship, not ideology.  His foresight appears validated by Zohran Mamdani's election as New York's first Muslim and South Asian mayor on a platform of housing affordability and debt relief, highlighting a growing demand for alternatives to a perceived rigged capitalist system.

title: ‘Govinda admitted, hum kya karein?’: IPS officer D Sivanandhan reveals how actors and musicians performed a show for Dawood Ibrahim’s daughter
description: In the 1990s, Bollywood's glamour was overshadowed by underworld influence, with gangsters financing hit films like 'Satya' and 'Company' to enhance their image. Actors and producers lived under constant threat, forced to comply with demands from figures like Dawood Ibrahim, as revealed by former Joint CP Crime Mumbai D Sivanandhan.

title: Gisele Bündchen Says Prioritizing Tom Brady Took a Personal Toll
description: Supermodel Gisele Bündchen, in a candid interview, shared insights into her marriage with Tom Brady, describing their split as a 'death and rebirth.' She detailed her journey of shifting from supporting her partner's career to rediscovering her own dreams and defining personal success. Bündchen emphasizes her graciousness towards Brady, highlighting her focus on authenticity and fulfillment in her new chapter.
